headerDisplay: Homebridge plugin to control a compatible smart bed.
footerDisplay: Homebridge-BedControl will auto-detect all devices associated with your account. If you have any issues, please submit a github ticket.

updateInterval.title: Update Interval (in seconds)
updateInterval.description: Set to a larger number to increase the time between fetching state from the bed platform. This can greatly reduce the number of network requests being made if you don't need immediate data (doesn't effect controlling the bed). Note, there is no benefit in setting it below 5 seconds. Certain bed companies have been known to go after accounts making too many network requests, so set this lower at your own risk. Setting it to 0 will disable the regular polling, making the occupancy sensors useless. The rest of the controls will continue to function without issue. I recommend setting it to at least 30 or 60 if you desire occupancy detection.

delay.title: Send Delay (in seconds)
delay.description: Controls the debounce delay between setting your sleep number using the slider in Homekit and the value being sent to the bed platform to adjust your bed.

ignore.title: Accessory Ignore List
ignore.description: Add accessories you don't want Homebridge to track in the format: <bedId>.<bedFeature>. For example: -9223372019955931774.leftSide.occupancy will hide the occupancy sensor on the left side of the selected bed, -9223372019955931774.anySide will hide all sensors for the combined 'anySide', and -9223372019955931774 will hide the entire bed. You can find your bedId if you examine the homebridge BedControl debug logs.
